Body: Description: Need to Investigate why  SQL scan is still running on the 2750 server from Dec 16 2024.  the scan is taking too long time to be completed.
@Scottie Taylor​ after completing initial response please set T1 owner to @Ilya Kotov​

What We've Learned Updated: Provided an initial response email requesting more information. 

Moved ticket to EMEA due to invalid region
Invitation updated. Attendees: Ilya Kotov, Kaviya -, Stealth Audit
Invitation updated. Attendees: No attendees listed
Steps to Reproduce Updated: Scan around 650 SQL servers at once

What We've Learned Updated: Provided an initial response email requesting more information. 

Moved ticket to EMEA due to invalid region

We have started by checking the stats on the job running for over 30 days. Then we proceeded to confirm that this job, in fact, is still processing SQL servers of undetermined total size (you have around 640 of those). I've explained that scans on such scale can take staggering amount of time due to the amount of the data that needs to be processed and recommended to discuss with Alison if this is absolutely necessary to do. If it is, I suggest doing this scan in smaller chunks and using filtering, for example, not scanning StealthAUDIT database.
Next Steps Updated: Awaiting client's confirmation.

1-SQL_PermissionsScan Job is the main job affected but there could be others
